intro: Scandix odorata, commonly known as the sweetroot or sweet cicely, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its root is edible and has a mild, sweet aroma, often used in culinary applications. Scandix odorata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
